trans-unit.source: Defines an installer that either succeeds completely or fails and leaves the computer in its initial state.
To run installers in a transaction, add them to the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Installers%2A> property of this <xref:System.Configuration.Install.TransactedInstaller> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.Install.TransactedInstaller"></xref> class.

This method calls the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.TransactedInstaller.Install%2A> method of each installer contained in the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Installers%2A> property of this instance.
The <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> object referenced by the `savedState` parameter is updated to reflect the status of the installation after the contained installers have run.
If all the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.TransactedInstaller.Install%2A> methods succeed, the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Commit%2A> method is called.
Otherwise, the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Rollback%2A> method is called for each installer.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> in which this method saves information needed to perform a commit, rollback, or uninstall operation.
The installation failed, and is being rolled back.
Call this method to remove a previously completed installation.

This <xref:System.Configuration.Install.TransactedInstaller.Uninstall%2A> method calls the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Uninstall%2A> method of each installer in the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Installers%2A> property to uninstall any resources set during installation.
Any exceptions during uninstallation are ignored.

Although the <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Install%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.Install.Installer.Commit%2A> methods save the state of the computer after the installations, the file containing the <xref:System.Collections.IDictionary> from the `savedState` parameter might have been deleted at some point after the installation was complete.
If the file is deleted, the `savedState` parameter is `null`.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> that contains the state of the computer after the installation completed.
